dialogs.line: Ah! So you chose to go without armor. My friend, the other knight, is proud of you!
We’re waiting up in the tower to celebrate! You moved through the forest with such agility without all that heavy metal.
Agility is fine… until an arrow finds its mark.
But I’m sure you'll manage with your ‘trust’ in others—just hope they’re there when you need them.
Ha! Don’t listen to him. We’re stronger together, and we’ll keep each other safe.
Isn’t that right?

dialogs.question: One last chance: will you reconsider and take some armor to shield yourself?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll take the armor. Maybe some protection is worth it.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll go without. My allies are all the protection I need.

dialogs.line: There. A wise choice at last. May this armor serve you well.
Well, if that’s what you believe... but remember, we’re still here for you.
Don’t let the armor keep us too far away.
Excellent! You’ve chosen trust over barriers. My friend will be thrilled, and we’ll stand strong together.
Bah. Suit yourself. Don’t come crying if a blade finds its mark.
Oh… so you took the armor. My friend—the other knight—is a bit… disappointed.
They had hoped you’d trust in them and in our support instead.
Disappointment? Bah! When a blow lands, disappointment won’t shield you.
I think you could do with even more armor—one can never be too safe.
Are you sure that armor is truly what you need?
We want to help you, not see you shut yourself away behind layers of metal.

dialogs.question: So, what now? Keep what you have, add more, or shed some to show trust in your allies?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll buy more armor. Better safe than sorry.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll shed some armor. My allies are all the protection I need.
dialogs.answer2: I’ll keep what I have. It’s a balanced choice.

dialogs.line: A wise choice, truly! Extra armor will protect you well.
So be it... but remember, there’s more to strength than steel.
I hope you’ll still let us in, friend.
Ah, you’ve decided to let go of some of that armor. My friend will be pleased!
We’ll face any danger together, as comrades.
Hmph. That’s your choice, I suppose. Just don’t blame me if you find yourself outmatched.
Keeping what you have? Well, balance is something, I suppose.
Just remember to stay vigilant.
That’s fair. Stay steady, friend. We’re with you, armor or not.
